newsitem.title: USA: Alcoa U.K. division cutting capacity, jobs.
newsitem.headline: Alcoa U.K. division cutting capacity, jobs.

text.p: Alcoa Manufacturing (Great Britain) Ltd said on Tuesday it was restructuring its Waunarlwydd Works facility in Swansea, Wales, in a move that will result in a 25 percent reduction in production capacity.
About 100 jobs will be eliminated in the restructuring, the company said. The reduction will take place by year-end.
Alcoa Manufacturing (Great Britain) is a unit of Aluminum Co of America, the world's largest aluminum company.

Paul Thomas, the unit's managing director, said, "This restructuring, along with the recently announced addition of a low-cost scrap remelting facility on the plantsite, is vital to maintaining AMGB's position as Europe's lowest cost and only dedicated producer of aluminum end and tab stock."
